title: looking for a beautiful script font
content:

thanks so much everyone!

comments.content:
When you answer that can you also answer this:

What is a good choice for a non-script font for a wedding invitation? There is a lot of talk about scripts but I need something for the body text. Right now I have it in garamond. Any other suggestions.

Did you take a look over there : [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121180830/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script")

Hey Sim,  
Yes, I did look at myfonts but didn’t find anything i liked....:(

autumnlind, in my Opinion, [Goudy Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121180830/http:/www.linotype.com/497/goudyoldstyle-family.html) is a great non-script font for a wedding invitation. At least if you are going for a classic look. Especially the italic with its minimal slope can very much survive on its own for the text body of your invitation and isn’t confined to be used as an emphasizing supplement of the roman.
